package.name: serendipity_event_adminnotes
package.description: Displays information for authors on the administration panel

package.name: serendipity_event_aggregator
package.description: Display entries from multiple RSS feeds ("Planet"). IMPORTANT NOTE: Updating and "feeding" your Aggregator must currently still happen manually via Cronjobs or similar. Call this URL with your custom timing interval: index.php?/plugin/aggregator

maintainer.name: Evan Nemerson, Garvin Hicking, Kristian Koehntopp, Thomas Schulz, Claus Schmidt

package.name: serendipity_event_amazonchooser
package.description: Adds a button to allow Amazon.com search which are insertable into your entry

package.name: serendipity_event_assigncategories
package.description: Lets you assign multiple categories to entries

package.name: serendipity_event_autotitle
package.description: Set the title-tag into the links of the entry.

package.name: serendipity_event_autoupdate
package.description: When the dashboard-plugin (once a day) detects an update, this plugin adds the option to manually download or start an automatic and secured upgrade of the blog directly with one click from within the adminarea.

package.name: serendipity_event_backend
package.description: Provides javascript output of recent entries for inclusion on other, extern websites. (see the README in the plugins directory!)

package.name: serendipity_event_backendrss
package.description: Displays a RSS feed on the overview page (right after login) to the administration interface

package.name: serendipity_event_backup
package.description: Provides the ability to automatically make backups from your s9y, the database-tables, the whole database and the files. Only MySQL(i) databases are currently supported. WARNING: This plugin does not work well with large databases or directories.

package.name: serendipity_event_browserid
package.description: Allows authors to authenticate using the BrowserID service.

package.name: serendipity_event_cal
package.description: Shows an event calendar inside your blogs with your normal blog design. It supports backend/frontend administration, multiple events and iCal export. (MySQL-only)

package.name: serendipity_event_categorytemplates
package.description: This plugin provides additional properties for categories and their entries, including custom templates, sort order, display limit, password protection, and RSS hiding.

package.name: serendipity_event_ckeditor
package.description: Uses CKEditor as the default WYSIWYG editor. For any JS-Editor usage: Recommended! After installation, go to the configuration screen of this plugin for further instructions.

package.name: serendipity_event_comics
package.description: Run webcomics in your blog

package.name: serendipity_event_commentedit
package.description: Let user's edit their comments after they posted them.

package.name: serendipity_event_commentsearch
package.description: If this plugin is installed, the quicksearch on your blog will also search through comments on your blog

package.name: serendipity_event_commentspice
package.description: Spice up your comments area with goodies like commenters twitter or last posted article link and nofollows by rules.

package.name: serendipity_event_contactform
package.description: Shows a email contactform on your blog as a static page. It can be accessed by either the custom permalink or by index.php?serendipity[subpage]=contactform. You can customize the look of the contact form by putting the plugin_contactform.tpl file into your template directory and modify it there. Captchas from the Spamblock plugin (if enabled) will be applied.

package.name: serendipity_event_contentrewrite
package.description: Replaces words with a new selected string (useful for acronyms)

package.name: serendipity_event_cpgselector
package.description: Select images from a Coppermine gallery in new entries

package.name: serendipity_event_cronjob
package.description: This plugin periodically executes plugins that provide/require periodic tasks. See the configuration of this plugin for details.

package.name: serendipity_event_custom_permalinks
package.description: Defines custom permalinks that can be used to access a specific entry. It can only use URL patterns which are NOT YET in use - using custom permalinks within the /archives/ structure is thus not possible. But any (virtual) other directory is.

package.name: serendipity_event_customarchive
package.description: Shows a sortable view of all past articles for the visitor. The link to this page should be inserted into a HTML nugget.

package.name: serendipity_event_dbclean
package.description: Cleanup database

package.name: serendipity_event_dejure
package.description: Automatically links quoted statues and judicature (references and source of information) with contents of dejure.org.

package.name: serendipity_event_disqus
package.description: Disqus.com is a webservice that allows you to manage comments, with central logins. It stores and manages comments outside of your Serendipity installation, and is embedded using JavaScript. For more information see disqus.com.

package.name: serendipity_event_downloadmanager
package.description: Provides full downloadmanager capabilities to your s9y. When uninstalling, all related tables will be dropped!

package.name: serendipity_event_dpsyntaxhighlighter
package.description: This plugin is a JavaScript code highlighter based on the code of the same name by Alex Gorbatchev. This plugin takes less server-side resources than GeSHi and displays less markup in the actual HTML code. It's a lighter, cleaner alternative. This plugin requires the supporting theme to provide the following hooks: frontend_header, frontend_footer (and optionally backend_preview on the administrative theme only).

maintainer.name: Alex Gorbatchev (core), Brendon Kozlowski and J.M. Roth (plugin)

package.name: serendipity_event_dsgvo_gdpr
package.summary: DSGVO / GDPR: General Data Protection Regulation
package.description: This plugin aims to help blog owners apply conformity to the General Data Protection Regulation Act.

package.name: serendipity_event_email_bot_obfuscator
package.summary: Markup: clickable email adresses - but with antispam
package.description: Makes email addresses clickabe, but obfuscates them to block spam harvester bots

package.name: serendipity_event_emoticonchooser
package.description: Shows a toolbar to select emoticons to insert into your entry.

package.name: serendipity_event_entrycheck
package.description: Applies some checks before an entry is published. Does not work with WYSIWYG-CKEDITOR!

package.name: serendipity_event_entrylastmodified
package.description: Shows a message with the last modification date of an entry on the blogs frontpage. For not modified entries shows a message that says they are not modified.

package.name: serendipity_event_entrypaging
package.description: Allows viewing the next/previous entry when viewing

package.name: serendipity_event_entrysplit
package.description: Enables you to split longer entries into several subpages and provides you with an auto-generated table of contents

maintainer.name: Garvin Hicking, Tadashi Jokagi, Thomas Werner

package.name: serendipity_event_externalauth
package.description: Allows to use external ressource to validate logins. Logins will be cached in the Serendipity database framework. This plugin can also track logins inside the Database.

package.name: serendipity_event_externalphp
package.description: Shows an external PHP application inside your blog with your blogs design and all formattings. USE WITH CARE, THIS PLUGIN HAS SECURITY IMPLICATIONS AS IT INCLUDES ANY GENERIC PHP FILE! YOU CAN ONLY USE THIS PLUGIN AS ADMIN!

package.name: serendipity_event_facebook
package.description: Imports comments made on facebook postings (like through RSS Graffiti) back into the blog. Also embeds Facebook OpenGraph Meta-Tags into the blog. Note that adding "like"-Buttons to blog entries is achieved via the serendipity_event_findmore plugin!

package.name: serendipity_event_faq
package.description: Edit the Frequently Asked Question.

package.name: serendipity_event_filter_entries
package.description: Allows visitors to filter/order your entries by several options

package.name: serendipity_event_flattr
package.description: Flattr is a social micropayment platform that lets you show love for the things you like. This plugin embedds "Flattr"-Badges in blog entries and RSS feeds. You can specify flattr-specific options per-entry, with a default global fallback.

package.name: serendipity_event_flickr
package.description: Import images from flickr.com into the media library

package.name: serendipity_event_forgotpassword
package.description: Change the password for selected user

package.name: serendipity_event_forum
package.description: Provides a complete discussion forum to your users. Can alternatively provide to mirror comments into a phpBB installation.

package.name: serendipity_event_freetag
package.description: Allows freestyle tagging of entries

maintainer.name: Garvin Hicking, Jonathan Arkell, Grischa Brockhaus, Lars Strojny, Malte Paskuda, Ian

package.name: serendipity_event_galleryimage
package.description: Inserts a Gallery album or image using markup text.

package.name: serendipity_event_geo_json
package.description: Provides a JSON object which contains all geographic data and can be processed with JavaScript

package.name: serendipity_event_geotag
package.description: Allows entries to be geotagged with coordinates

maintainer.name: Zoran Kovacevic, Grischa Brockhaus, Matthias Gutjahr, Martin Sewelies

package.name: serendipity_event_geourl
package.description: GeoURL allocates URLs to locations. More Information at http://geourl.org/

package.name: serendipity_event_geshi
package.description: Computer Language Color Syntax Highlighting. Tag usage: [geshi lang=lang_name [,ln={y|n}]]code snippet[/geshi]

package.name: serendipity_event_getid3
package.summary: getID3() support for fetching media properties
package.description: Uses the getID3() library to fetch extended media properties for movies/audio files. getID3() itself is not distributed with this plugin.

package.name: serendipity_event_glossary
package.description: A user defined glossary as highlighted text with a tooltip.

package.name: serendipity_event_google_analytics
package.description: This plugin adds extendet Google Analytic funcionality to youre Page like tracking external links or download links.

package.name: serendipity_event_google_sitemap
package.description: Creates a sitemap.xml.gz, which can be used by miscellaneous Web-Crawlers. (Google, MSN, Yahoo and Ask)

package.name: serendipity_event_gravatar
package.description: Show avatars inside comments. Gravatars, Pavatars, Favatars, Twitter, Identica and MyBlogLog avatars are supported.

package.name: serendipity_event_guestbook
package.description: Shows a guestbook inside your blog with your normal blog design.

package.name: serendipity_event_head_nugget
package.description: Allows you to insert HTML-Code into the HEAD-area of your blog. You can use this for meta-tags or JavaScript inclusion.

package.name: serendipity_event_httpauth
package.description: Authenticates users via HTTP auth using their s9y user login data.

package.name: serendipity_event_imageselectorplus
package.description: Allows extended options for inserting images from the media manager [Serendipity >= 0.9]

maintainer.name: Garvin Hicking, Vladimir Ajgl, Adam Charnock, Ian

package.name: serendipity_event_includeentry
package.description: Allows you to add HTML-style tags to your entry that includes parts of other entrys. Use this markup: [s9y-include-entry:XXX:YYY]. Replace XXX with the target entryid and YYY with the target field name (i.e. "body", "title", "extended", ...). You can also use the new menu functions to maintain templates and blocks that can get inserted in between your entries.

package.name: serendipity_event_karma
package.description: Позволяет посетителям оценивать ваши записи

maintainer.name: Garvin Hicking, Grischa Brockhaus, Judebert, Gregor Voeltz, Ian

package.name: serendipity_event_kubrickheader
package.description: Switch header image or logo for templates

maintainer.name: Garvin Hicking, Sebastian Mayeres, Jude Anthony

package.name: serendipity_event_layout_printerfriendly
package.description: Using the print function of your browser, you will see a better printed representation of your Entry

package.name: serendipity_event_lightbox
package.description: Lightbox JS is a simple, unobtrusive script used to overlay images on the current page. It's a snap to setup and works with all modern browsers. All lightboxes pop-up images. This plugin searches through your entries, and replaces every image 'a href="XXX"' link to use the internal display. So if you want your thumbnail images to popup large, you need to insert your images as links to the large version. To display also hidden set images by display:none, use lightbox2. These lightbox scripts are all jQuery based. They do not only support image types, they may also add support for ajax, videos, flash, YouTube, iFrame, inline, or modal boxes. This Plugin uses them for image lightboxes only, but you can easily add other content types manually to your entries and start the chosen lightbox as described in their online documentaries.

maintainer.name: Thomas Nesges, Andy Hopkins, Lokesh Dhakar, Cody Lindley, Stephan Manske, Grischa Brockhaus, Ian

package.name: serendipity_event_linklist
package.description: Links manager - Shows your favorite links in the sidebar.

package.name: serendipity_event_linktoolbar
package.description: Inserts link rel="start|up|prev|next|canonical" metatags into your frontend for better navigation.

package.name: serendipity_event_linktrimmer
package.description: Allows you to truncate any link for redirection on your own blog, like tr.im, tinyurl.com etc.

package.name: serendipity_event_livecomment
package.description: Uses JavaScript to show a live preview and markup-buttons

package.name: serendipity_event_livesearch
package.description: Enhances the internal search function by adding live-updates on keypress (JavaScript)

package.name: serendipity_event_ljupdate
package.description: Uses XMLRPC to post to your Livejournal/MySpace/Serendipity

package.name: serendipity_event_loginform
package.description: Validates the login credentials of an author using the sidebar login form

package.name: serendipity_event_mailentry
package.description: Allow users to e-mail a blog entry to a friend. Pay attention that this plugin can cause automatted traffic if bots are submitting your forms.

package.name: serendipity_event_markdown
package.description: Apply Markdown markup to entry text

maintainer.name: Serendipity Team, Jan Lehnardt and Thomas Hochstein

package.name: serendipity_event_markread
package.summary: Show read/unread state of entries for visitors
package.description: Show read/unread state of entries for visitors

package.name: serendipity_event_metadesc
package.description: Sets HTML meta keywords/description tags and title element for single entry pages and default meta keywords/description tags for non-single entry pages.

package.name: serendipity_event_microformats
package.description: This plugin provides an easy way to publish reviews (or events); it supports the respective microformats.

package.name: serendipity_event_mimetex
package.description: Create Gifs from TeX expressions using MimeTex or LaTeX

package.name: serendipity_event_mobile_output
package.description: This plugin handles mobile devices and outputs optimized XHTML MP markup if it detects a mobile browser and a specially optimized site for iPhone and iPod Touch. It also scales images to fit the display size.

package.name: serendipity_event_multilingual
package.description: Allows to create multiple language versions of an entry

package.name: serendipity_event_mycalendar
package.description: Maintains a personal calendar

maintainer.name: Garvin Hicking, Markus Gerstel, Grischa Brockhaus

package.name: serendipity_event_mymood
package.description: Allows you to add your current mood or moods to entries.

package.name: serendipity_event_newsbox
package.description: Group a category's entries in a frontpage box instead of the usual article listing. Supports nested newsboxes.

package.name: serendipity_event_oembed
package.description: oEmbed is a format for allowing an embedded representation of a URL on your blog. It allows blog articles to display embedded content (such as tweets, photos or videos) when a user posts a link to that resource, without having to parse the resource directly.

package.name: serendipity_event_openid
package.description: Allows authors to authenticate using an OpenID, their Google or Yahoo account.

package.name: serendipity_event_osm
package.description: Provides an interactive map for *.gpx uploads and geo-tagged entries

package.name: serendipity_event_static_osm
package.description: Includes scripts and stylesheets for OpenStreetMap support

package.name: serendipity_event_outdate_entries
package.summary: Hide/delete entries for non-registered users after a specific timespan
package.description: Hides all entries which are older than a specified age, so that they are only visible for registered users/authors.

package.name: serendipity_event_page_nugget
package.description: Puts an HTML nugget on top or bottom of the page, or inside the page's HEAD tag

package.name: serendipity_event_photoblog
package.description: Adds a single image to an entry.

package.name: serendipity_event_podcast
package.description: Adds "podcasting" capabilities hinzu (RSS enclosure, Video/Sound-Player)

maintainer.name: Grischa Brockhaus, Hannes Gassert, Garvin Hicking

package.name: serendipity_event_popfetcher
package.description: Fetches and publishes email and attachments from a POP3 email account (with special cell phone support)

package.name: serendipity_event_prettify
package.description: Use Prettify to brush content between PRE tags for simple syntax highlighting.

package.name: serendipity_event_proxy_realip
package.description: Sets the correct Visitors IP when useing a Proxy for your webserver. Should be the first plugin in the list.

package.name: serendipity_event_randomblogdescription
package.description: Shows a random description in the header. (Seperate database table has currently to be maintained manually)

package.name: serendipity_event_realtimecomments
package.description: Load comments made from other users without reloading the page.

package.name: serendipity_event_recaptcha
package.description: Enabling a recaptcha for commenting articles (You need to apply for a key)

maintainer.name: Christian Brabandt (based on work of Garvin Hicking, Sebastian Nohn)

package.name: serendipity_event_regexpmarkup
package.description: Mark up via user custom regexp files. See example files in "regexps" subdirectory of this plugin.

package.name: serendipity_event_relatedlinks
package.description: Insert related links/entries per entry. For flexibility you can edit the "plugin_relatedlinks.tpl" Smarty-Template file to adjust the output. Note that this plugin only outputs data in the detailed/full entry view.

package.name: serendipity_event_searchhighlight
package.description: Highlights queries used in the referring search engine to locate your page

package.name: serendipity_event_sidebarhider
package.description: Shrinks Sidebars to just their titles. Extra configuration in Entries -> Manage Sidebars in the Admin Suite.

package.name: serendipity_event_smartymarkup
package.description: Parses Smarty instructions inside the article text. This is not usable in combination with syntax code-highlighters or multilingual tags in entry context fields!

package.name: serendipity_event_smtpmail
package.description: Use a SMTP server to send your mails

package.name: serendipity_event_social
package.description: Show social share buttons for services like Facebook and Twitter using shariff.

package.name: serendipity_event_spamblock_bayes
package.description: Detects Spam via an algorithmus which learns.

maintainer.name: kleinerChemiker, Malte Paskuda, based upon b8 by Tobias Leupold

package.name: serendipity_event_spamblock_bee
package.description: Implements simple comment antispam mechanisms, that are easy to configure but very effective.

package.name: serendipity_event_spamblock_rbl
package.description: Will reject comments made from hosts which are listed in RBLs. Pay attention that this may affect proxy-users or dial-up users.

package.name: serendipity_event_spamblock_surbl
package.description: Reject comments that contain blacklisted URLs

package.name: serendipity_event_startcat
package.description: Allows you to show only one category on the frontpage

package.name: serendipity_event_staticpage
package.description: Shows static pages inside your blog with your blogs design and all formattings. Adds a new menu item to the admin interface.

maintainer.name: Marco Rinck, Garvin Hicking, David Rolston, Falk Doering, Stephan Manske, Pascal Uhlmann, Ian, Don Chambers

package.name: serendipity_event_statistics
package.description: Adds a link to interesting statistics in your entries panel, including a visitors counter

maintainer.name: Arnan de Gans, Garvin Hicking, Fredrik Sandberg, kalkin, Matthias Mees, Ian

package.name: serendipity_event_suggest
package.description: Allows non-registered authors to suggest entries for publishing

package.name: serendipity_event_template_editor
package.description: Edit the files of the currently used template directly form the adminarea.

package.name: serendipity_event_textlinkads
package.description: Embeds Ads into your page.

package.name: serendipity_event_textwiki
package.description: Markup text using Text_Wiki

package.name: serendipity_event_thumbnails
package.description: Shows a thumbnail page. Address is index.php?serendipity[page]=thumbs

package.name: serendipity_event_tinypng
package.description: Compress PNG and JPG images with the TinyPNG service.

package.name: serendipity_event_todolist
package.description: Maintain a list of projects and their percentage completion.

package.name: serendipity_event_tooltips
package.description: Activate Tooltips Text and Images.

package.name: serendipity_event_trackback
package.description: Allows granular control over how trackbacks are sent when creating entries

package.name: serendipity_event_trackexits
package.description: Track clicks on external URLs

package.name: serendipity_event_typesetbuttons
package.description: Adds buttons for various encoded typeset entities and other extended actions.

maintainer.name: Matthew Groeninger, Malte Diers, Matthias Gutjahr

package.name: serendipity_event_typoquote
package.description: Convert straight quotes to smart quotes. Also can use SmartyPants PHP library (by Michel Fortin, based on SmartyPants by John Gruber) to provide further typographic replacement.

package.name: serendipity_event_unstrip_tags
package.description: Allows to insert HTML tags in comments (instead of stripping the tags, they are now converted to entities). Needs to be first of all markup plugins in the event queue!

package.name: serendipity_event_usergallery
package.description: Allows anonymous users to view Serendipity media gallery

maintainer.name: Arnan de Gans, Matthew Groeninger, and Stefan Willoughby, Ian

package.name: serendipity_event_userprofiles
package.description: Shows simple user profiles and allows to embed author pictures.

package.name: serendipity_event_versioning
package.description: Can store and retrieve older versions of an entry

package.name: serendipity_event_vgwort
package.description: Integrate VG Wort counters into your blog.

package.name: serendipity_event_weblogping
package.description: Send notification of new entries to online services

package.name: serendipity_event_wikilinks
package.summary: Free Wiki links for your entries
package.description: You can specify new/existing links to your blog entries via [[title]], link to staticpages via ((title)) and link to both via {{title}}. References can be automatically appended to the blog entry.

package.name: serendipity_event_wrapurl
package.description: Wraps another page in an IFRAME to be displayed in the body

package.name: serendipity_event_xmlrpc
package.description: Allows to post/edit entries via the XML-RPC API (MT, Blogger, WordPress Endpoints)

package.name: serendipity_event_xsstrust
package.summary: Options for trustworthy editing on multi-user blogs / HTMLPurifier
package.description: This plugin can specify, which authors on a multi-user blog you have enough trust in and do not expect hacking attempts. All other users are treated as possibly evil and cannot create HTML entries.

package.name: serendipity_event_youtube
package.description: Offers more buttons to the editing screen to implement easy access to HTML/JS snippets like Youtube etc.

package.name: serendipity_event_adduser
package.description: Allows blog visitors to create their own author account. Together with the Event-plugin (index.php?serendipity[subpage]=adduser) you can choose whether only registered users may post comments.

package.name: serendipity_event_flickrcss
package.description: This plugin is an extension to the flickr Photostream sidebar plugin and adds style information (CSS).

package.name: serendipity_event_pollbox
package.description: Maintains your votings / polls

package.name: serendipity_event_twitter
package.description: Adds a twitter/identica client to the admininistration interface, searches for tweetbacks and announces new articles to a microblogging account.
